info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:59PM EDT until July 05 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR DAVIDSON COUNTY... At 658 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Thomasville, or 8 miles northeast of Lexington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts are imminent in Thomasville. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Linwood, Arcadia, Welcome and High Rock Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
